title: What is a Rational Function? Quiz

questionList.qu: Which one of these functions is the base function of a rational function?
questionList.solution: `y = 1/x`, as its the simplest form of a rational function

questionList.a1: A line in a graph where a function gets closer but never touches
questionList.a2: A line in a graph where a function gets closer but touches
questionList.a3: A line in a graph where a function gets farther but never touches
questionList.a4: A line in a graph where a function crosses
questionList.solution: A line in a graph where a function gets closer but never touches

questionList.qu: For the equation `y = 1/x`, as x tends to `0^{+}`...
questionList.solution: y tends to `infty^{+}`, as x is coming to the asymptote from the negative side

questionList.qu: When an equation is written `(ax+b)/(cx+d)`, what is an easy way to determine a vertical asymptote in all cases?
questionList.solution: Since nothing can be divided by 0, if cx+d (the denominator) is 0, it cannot be equal to that x value.

questionList.qu: When an equation is written `(ax+b)/(cx+d)`, what is an easy way to determine the x-intercepts in all cases?
questionList.solution: Since 0 divided by anything is 0, making ax+b (the numerator) equal 0 will result in a y-value of 0, which is the x-axis, allowing you to find the x-intercepts.

questionList.a3: Has no x or y intercepts
questionList.solution: Due to a restriction in the domain, as that causes a gap since x cannot be the listed number (`x = 0` in this case)
